snippet: The Marvell Technology Group gave a positive earnings forecast and said sales of smartphone chips in China were beginning to improve, setting off an 11 percent gain in its share price.

headline.main: Earnings Outlook Lifts Shares of Marvell Technology

snippet: It’s surprising how many movies cannot be streamed or downloaded. And not just obscure art films, but popular movies, too.
abstract: It’s surprising how many movies cannot be streamed or downloaded. And not just obscure art films, but popular movies, too.

snippet: Mobile phones replacing wallets is clearly in the future, but the type of technology we use and how long it takes for it to be adopted is still up for debate.

snippet: Howard Stringer’s efforts at Sony have been stymied by the effects of the March 11 earthquake and tsunami, a hacker attack on the PlayStation network and other troubles.

headline.main: Sony Chief Still in Search of a Turnaround
headline.print_headline: Sony Chief Still in Search of a Turnaround

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and BROOKS BARNES

snippet: The profit estimate of 80 billion yen, or $978 million, for the current business year, comes a few days after Sony warned that it would post a 260 billion yen loss for the past financial year.

headline.main: Sony Sets Profit Target Lower Than Expected
headline.print_headline: Sony Sets Profit Target Lower Than Expected

snippet: TOKYO -- In Sony's 1993 comedy ''Groundhog Day,'' Bill Murray finds himself reliving the same dreary course of events, day after day.     It is as good an analogy as any to Howard Stringer's stint as chief executive of Sony, the electronics and en...
abstract: Howard Stringer, Sony chief executive, has been continually stymied in six-year effort to turn company around, most recently by earthquake and tsunami in Japan and hacker attack on Playstation 3 network; company was forced to take $3.2 billion net loss for business year, biggest deficit in 16 years and third loss in a row; photos (M)

headline.main: Sony Chief Still in Search of a Turnaround

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and BROOKS BARNES; Brooks Barnes reported from Los Angeles
